thread.title: Manny Pacquiao vs Amir Khan fight CONFIRMED as Pac Man says 'it's what the fans wanted'
thread.title_full: Manny Pacquiao vs Amir Khan fight CONFIRMED as Pac Man says 'it's what the fans wanted'

author: David Anderson
title: Manny Pacquiao vs Amir Khan fight CONFIRMED as Pac Man says 'it's what the fans wanted'
text:
Sport Manny Pacquiao vs Amir Khan fight CONFIRMED as Pac Man says 'it's what the fans wanted' The pair have long been linked with going toe to toe and Pacquiao has confirmed it will take place in April Share Amir Khan and Manny Pacquiao will fight on April 23rd (Photo: Action Images) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The blockbuster fight fans have been waiting for between Manny Pacquiao and Amir Khan has finally been CONFIRMED. 
The Brit and Pac Man have long been linked with going toe to toe in what would be highly-anticipated clash of two of the biggest stars in boxing. 
And last night both parties confirmed terms have now been agreed. 
Pacquiao tweeted: "Negotiations between team Pacquiao and team Khan have come to terms for the April 23 bout as this is what the fans wanted." 
Khan added: "My team an I have agreed terms with Manny Pacquiao and his team for a super fight" 
Khan, 30, was confident of fighting Pacquiao two years after the eight-weight world champion pulled out of a proposed clash between the pair. 
However he had been waiting on WBO welterweight king Pacquiao to sign his end of the deal to make the fight happen. Khan was set to take a tune-up fight after being viciously knocked out by Canelo Alvarez (Photo: REUTERS) The Bolton fighter gives a thumbs up whilst watching UFC 208 (Photo: Zuffa LLC) Read More Manny Pacquiao polls fans on Twitter to choose his next opponent - and it's good news for Amir Khan 
Pacquiao, 38, was under pressure from fans to face two-time light-welterweight champion Khan after the Bolton fighter topped an online poll to choose his next opponent. 
The United Arab Emirates has been mooted as a possible venue, while Khan's team believe they could tempt Pacquiao to the Macron Stadium. 
But Khan's wife said on Twitter that the bout has been confirmed to take place on April 23rd in Dubai. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
